channel.title: adobo & avocados on Nicole van der Hoeven
channel.description: Recent content in adobo & avocados on Nicole van der Hoeven

item.title: Learning about Glue Work and Quiet Quitting (Adobo & Avocados #25)
item.description: What is glue work, and how is it linked to quiet quitting and quality engineering? In this episode of Adobo and Avocados, Vernon Richards talks to Marie Cruz and me about what glue work is, the dangers of quiet quitting, its implications with quality engineering, and what we can do about it.

item.title: DevOps Culture from a Tester's Perspective (Adobo & Avocados #24)
item.description: We’ve all heard of DevOps, but what is DevOps from a tester’s perspective? How can we embrace this culture? In this episode of Adobo and Avocados, the one and only Lisa Crispin talks to my friend Marie Cruz and me about DevOps culture from a testing mindset, what holistic testing is really about, and her journey to being one of the well-respected voices in the testing community.

item.title: Personal Branding for Engineers (Adobo & Avocados #23)
item.description:
This week we’re talking about personal branding for engineers and how you can reframe that as learning in public. Whether you’re a software developer, a tester, or a platform engineer, creating a personal brand can help you learn faster, get noticed in your niche, and make meaningful connections. We discuss some practical tips we’ve learned throughout our careers for how to advocate for ourselves in a humble, authentic way.

Resources

  • Tools for publishing and distribution (Nicole’s notes)

item.title: Navigating through Unemployment with Renata Andrade (Adobo & Avocados #22)
item.description: With the rise of redundancies in the tech industry, how do you navigate through unemployment calmly? In this episode of Adobo and Avocados, Renata Andrade, a Quality Engineer Lead, talks to Marie Cruz and me about her experience navigating unemployment and the steps she followed to bounce back.

item.title: Minimalism in Software Testing with Lina Zubyte (Adobo & Avocados #21)
item.description: How can we apply minimalism in software testing? Lina Zubyte, an Independent Quality Consultant, talks to Marie Cruz and I about what really matters in testing, why empathy is at the root of the testing attitude, and how we can incorporate principles from minimalism to improve quality.

item.title: Learning about experience design with Jenna Charlton (Adobo & Avocados #20)
item.description: In this episode of Adobo and Avocados, my friend Marie Cruz and I chat with fellow Developer Advocate Jenna Charlton, where they talk about their career journey, what can we learn from experience design, and the impact of different job titles to testers.

item.title: Becoming an accessibility advocate with Erin Crise (Adobo & Avocados #19)
item.description: In this episode of Adobo and Avocados, Marie Cruz and I speak with Erin Crise about her tech career journey, what led to her accessibility advocacy, and why empathy drives innovation.

item.title: Inspiring others and fuelling your passion with Jonah Andersson (Adobo & Avocados #18)
item.description: In this episode of Adobo & Avocados, my friend Marie Cruz and I chat with Jonah Andersson, a Software Developer, Cloud & DevOps Engineer, and the founder of Azure User Group Sweden. We spoke about her career journey and how she is fuelling her passion and inspiring others.

item.title: Having a coaching mindset with Kulas Angeles (Adobo & Avocados #17)
item.description: In this episode of Adobo and Avocados, my friend Marie Cruz and I chat with Kulas Angeles, a DevOps coach and Quality Engineering leader, about his career journey and how he transitioned from engineering to coaching mindset.

item.title: Investing in yourself with Nicola Lindgren (Adobo & Avocados #16)
item.description: My friend Marie Cruz and I talked with Nicola Lindgren about different ways we’ve all invested in ourselves and our career– and how you can do the same.

item.title: The Role of AI in Gender Equality with Nicola Martin (Adobo & Avocados #15)
item.description:
In this episode of Adobo and Avocados, my friend Marie Cruz and I chat with Nicola Martin, Head of Quality Engineering at Adarga, to talk about the role of AI, technology, and education in gender equality.

Nicola is a Council and Committee Member for the British Computer Society and WomenTech Global Network. She is also a mentor, speaker, and panelist speaking on subjects such as AI and quality, software testing, and diversity in tech.

item.title: The benefits and dangers of public speaking (Adobo & Avocados #14)
item.description: In this episode of Adobo and Avocados, my friend Marie Cruz and I chat with Maaret Pyhäjärvi, a Development Manager and Testing Specialist who has shared countless resources about exploratory testing. We talk about her journey to tech, the benefits and dangers of public speaking, and her approach to testing.

item.title: Winning over imposter syndrome with Sophie Küster (Adobo & Avocados #13)
item.description: My friend Marie Cruz and I chat with Sophie Küster, who currently works as a Test Automation Engineer, all about imposter syndrome.

item.title: Setting boundaries, time management, and essentialism (Adobo & Avocados #12)
item.description:
My friend Marie Cruz and I discuss setting boundaries and managing time. We also discuss what essentialism is and why less is better.

Get the Essentialism book here (affiliate link).

item.title: Navigating parenthood with Laveena Ramchandani (A&A #11)
item.description: My friend Marie Cruz and I speak to Laveena Ramchandani, a Digital and Data Science Test Manager at easyJet and also a Digital Star finalist, speaker, blogger, and coach. Laveena talks about her career journey and her journey to parenthood.

item.title: Making a career and being true to yourself with Lena Pejgan Nyström (Adobo & Avocados #10)
item.description:
My friend Marie Cruz and I speak to Lena Pejgan Nyström, the author and creator of Would Heu-risk it? cards and book about various topics!

Lena opens up about how she got started in tech and her career journey from being a developer turned tester and now an Engineering Manager as well as an international keynote speaker! We also discuss topics such as diversity in tech, dealing with burnout, and any struggles Lena experienced between making a career and being true to her personal beliefs.

item.title: What does an overloaded system look like for humans? (Adobo & Avocados #08)
item.description: My friend Marie Cruz and I talk about burnout from a more technical point of view. We discuss how burnout is similar to an overloaded system (and how it isn’t), and we draw comparisons on how to make an overloaded system more resilient and recover from burnout.
